User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Vocalize application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

googleId.description: Google identifier for the user, if they signed up with Google.

appleId.description: Apple identifier for the user, if they signed up with Apple.

gameCenterId.description: Game Center identifier for the user, if applicable.

anonymousId.description: Anonymous identifier for the user, if they are using the app anonymously.

smsMultiFactorAuthEnabled.description: Indicates if SMS multi-factor authentication is enabled for the user.

emailVerified.description: Indicates if the user's email address has been verified.

definition.description: Stores user profiles.  Path-based ownership ensures only the authenticated user can access their own data.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user, matching the Firebase Auth UID.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure secure and scalable data management for the Vocalize application, focusing on authorization independence and clear access control.  The primary entity is `User`, with user data stored in a path-based structure under `/users/{userId}`.  This provides simple ownership-based security rules and supports atomic operations. Since there are no collaborative data requirements or other entities, we maintain a flat structure centered around user-owned data.
